speaker: CADE
text: Where’s Dick, the butcher of Ashford?

speaker: CADE
text: They fell before thee like sheep and oxen, and

speaker: CADE
text: thou behaved’st thyself as if thou hadst been in

speaker: CADE
text: thine own slaughterhouse. Therefore, thus will I

speaker: CADE
text: reward thee: the Lent shall be as long again as it is,

speaker: CADE
text: and thou shalt have a license to kill for a hundred

speaker: CADE
text: And to speak truth, thou deserv’st no less. This

speaker: CADE
text: monument of the victory will I bear.

speaker: CADE
text: And the bodies shall be dragged at my horse

speaker: CADE
text: heels till I do come to London, where we will have

speaker: CADE
text: the Mayor’s sword borne before us.

speaker: DICK
text: If we mean to thrive and do good, break open

speaker: DICK
text: the jails and let out the prisoners.

speaker: CADE
text: Fear not that, I warrant thee. Come, let’s march
